etymology.interpretation: Names a condiment made from oysters and seasonings, widely used to enhance umami in stir-fries and marinades. Often refers specifically to the bottled sauce in Chinese cooking.
etymology.simplification: 蠔 was simplified to 蚝 by replacing the phonetic component 豪 with the simpler 号 under the 虫 radical, reducing strokes; 油 remained unchanged.

parts.english: oyster; oyster meat; edible bivalve; dried oyster

examples.chinese: 我喜欢用蚝油(我喜歡用蠔油)。
examples.english: I like to use oyster sauce.

examples.chinese: 这道菜加一点蚝油更鲜(這道菜加一點蠔油更鮮)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào cài jiā yìdiǎn háoyóu gèng xiān.
examples.english: This dish is tastier with a bit of oyster sauce.

examples.chinese: 用蚝油炒青菜最方便(用蠔油炒青菜最方便)。
examples.pinyin: Yòng háoyóu chǎo qīngcài zuì fāngbiàn.
examples.english: Using oyster sauce to stir-fry greens is very convenient.
